title: All Types Dialog Displays Obfuscated Classes
description: The All Types dialog in JDK 1.4 is displaying obfuscated classes such as 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc.
OB: The All Types dialog in JDK 1.4 is currently showing obfuscated classes like 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc.
EB: These obfuscated classes should have reduced visibility in the dialog.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Launch the JDK 1.4 software.
2. Open the 'All Types' dialog.
3. Observe that obfuscated classes are displayed.

To fix this issue, the following options can be considered:
a) Sort lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter.
b) Filter out obfuscated classes completely. I suggest implementing option a).
